Key Match Events: A 163-run stand between Rossouw and de Kock set South Africa up for a big first-innings total
Anrich Nortje completed what he had started, ending with 4 for 10
Shamsi too capitalised on the mountain of a score - courtesy Rossouw's career-best 109 - to get a confidence-boosting 3 for 20
Pre-Game Insights: Bavuma did exactly the right thing in giving enough play to the spinners as well in this sort of a game to find the necessary rhythm under the conditions and get cracking for the matches ahead
Post-Match Reflections: So South Africa not only win big, but also will be table toppers at least for a short while. They hold a huge net run rate at the moment - remember they couldn't make the semi-final last year just due to the NRR? - and might well have made up for the washout against Zimbabwe
Rilee Rossouw is the Player of the Match for his 109
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
